name: Quad Stretch
setup: Stand near a wall or sturdy surface for balance (or lie on your side)
Engage core lightly to maintain neutral spine
steps: Bend one knee and bring heel toward glutes
Grasp ankle or foot with same-side hand
Keep knees together and hips square forward
Gently pull heel closer to glutes to increase stretch
mistakes: Allowing lower back to arch excessively
Letting knee flare out to the side
safety: If standing version aggravates balance or knee, use lying side quad stretch instead. Avoid forcing stretch if knee pain occurs.

regressions: Lying side quad stretch (better for balance)
Reduce range - don't pull heel all the way to glutes
progressions: Standing quad stretch with hip extension (slightly push hips forward)
Couch stretch (elevated back foot on couch/bench)

prescriptionHints.notes: Post-run, post-basketball, or after lower body training. Focus on gentle sustained stretch, not aggressive pulling.

joints.notes: Keep hips square and avoid excessive lumbar extension. If knee discomfort, try lying variation or reduce range.
